CONCLUSION: Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary and non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant travelled from GPE to GPE in GPE through PERSON airport . She had on her MONEY ( ORG ) , CARDINAL NORP hryvnyas ( ORG ) and MONEY ( RUB ) . However , she only reported DATE and UAH CARDINAL in her customs declaration . The customs inspection uncovered the remaining ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL , which the applicant claimed she had forgotten about . She was charged with smuggling , a criminal offence under LAW . The money was appended to the criminal case as physical evidence ( вещественные доказательства ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of GPE found the applicant guilty as charged and imposed a suspended sentence of DATE imprisonment , conditional on DATE probation . As regards the money , it referred to LAW and held that :
“ Physical evidence – USD CARDINAL,CARDINAL and ORG CARDINAL held in the evidence storage room of ORG – shall revert to the ORG . ”

CARDINAL . NORP In his statement of appeal , counsel for the applicant contested the lawfulness of the confiscation measure . He submitted that the gravity of the offence should have been determined by reference to the amount the applicant had concealed from the customs , that is USD MONEY , rather than the entire amount she had carried . The money had been the object rather than the instrument of the offence and as such it should have been returned to the lawful owner because it had not been claimed that it had been criminally acquired .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment by a succinct decision , without examining the counsel 's arguments in detail .

CARDINAL . Counsel for the applicant submitted several applications for supervisory review of the judgments . The applications were rejected by a judge of ORG on DATE , the President of ORG on DATE , and a judge of ORG of GPE on DATE . As regards the confiscation measure , the judicial authorities maintained that the measure had been lawful and compliant with LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Presidium of ORG examined yet another application for supervisory review . It held that the applicant had been correctly found guilty of smuggling but amended the judgment in part concerning the confiscation measure , having found as follows :
“ However , the decision that the authentically declared amount of USD CARDINAL,CARDINAL and ORG CARDINAL should revert to the ORG was not founded on sufficient reasons .

In deciding that the foreign currency should revert to the ORG , the court posited that the currency transported by PERSON was the object of the offence . However , since her criminal intent was directed at the breach of the procedure for transferring cash money ( currency ) across the customs border rather than at their unlawful misappropriation , the cash money ( currency ) was not the object of the offence and therefore not liable to confiscation under LAW [ § CARDINAL ] ( CARDINAL ) of LAW .

Moreover , according to LAW ] ( CARDINAL ) of LAW , criminally acquired property , money or other valuables must revert to the ORG . The case file does not contain any evidence to the effect that PERSON obtained the above - mentioned money through criminal means or as the proceeds of criminal activity .
In such circumstances , the judgments in the part concerning the decision that the foreign currency should revert to the ORG may not be considered lawful or justified . ”
The ORG held that the judgments would be amended and that ORG CARDINAL and UAH CARDINAL would be returned to the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE a writ of execution was issued and sent to the bailiffs ' service for enforcement .

CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiffs determined that the enforcement was impossible because the cash money in the amount of USD CARDINAL,CARDINAL and UAH CARDINAL was absent from the evidence storage room of ORG . That money had been taken away on DATE by the bailiffs of GPE , which appeared to have made enforcement impossible .

CARDINAL . LAW of the Russian Federation provides that smuggling , that is movement of large amounts of goods or other objects across the customs border of GPE , committed by concealing such goods from the customs or combined with non - declaration or inaccurate declaration of such goods , carries a penal sanction of DATE imprisonment ( LAW ) .
CARDINAL . The Code of Criminal Procedure of GPE ( “ CCrP ” ) provides as follows :
“ CARDINAL . Any object may be recognised as physical evidence -
( CARDINAL ) that served as the instrument of the offence or retained traces of the offence ;
( CARDINAL ) NORP that was the target of the criminal acts ;
( CARDINAL ) any other object or document which may be instrumental for detecting a crime or establishing the circumstances of the criminal case .
CARDINAL . NORP On delivery of a conviction ... the destiny of physical evidence must be decided upon . In such a case –
( CARDINAL ) instruments of the crime belonging to the accused are liable to confiscation , transfer to competent authorities or destruction ;
( CARDINAL ) objects banned from circulation must be transferred to competent authorities or destroyed ;
( CARDINAL ) NORP non - reclaimed objects of no value must be destroyed ... ;
( CARDINAL ) NORP criminally acquired money and other valuables must revert to the ORG by a judicial decision ;
( CARDINAL ) documents must be kept with the case file ... ;
( CARDINAL ) any other objects must be returned to their lawful owners or , if the identity of the owner can not be established , transferred to the ORG ... ”
